summary: Rati finalized and committed his significant initial investigation report for `rasdaman-mcp`, churning 359 lines of analysis to officially close out the projectâ€™s first major milestone.
Rati tackled the tedious but necessary task of updating his GitHub profile, ensuring his academic status and showcased project links were sharp and finally badge-free.
Rati deployed a massive, 1500-line refactor to `kickstart.nvim`, turning his Neovim setup into a speedy, fully-documented beast by lazy-loading everything and implementing pro workflow tools.
Rati delivered a colossal architectural overhaul to AIRA, migrating memory to ChromaDB and SQLite while adding system-wide theming and Linux file manager hooks in a nearly 2,000-line push.
Rati wasn't messing around; he shipped 2,200 lines to give Orchard serious chops: sparse sync, rock-solid threading, custom desktop emblems, and a shiny new GTK control panel.

With nearly 200 lines of code in Orchard, Rati tackled the nightmare of intermittent connections, implementing offline persistence and a brutal "local wins" conflict resolution strategy via pre-emptive remote deletes.
Rati wrapped up the year with a nearly 1,700-line bang in *Orchard*, perfecting the sync engine with shadow state and making sure the exhaustive architecture docs matched the new reality.
